intro: Conyza pungens, commonly known as horseweed, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and other open areas. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive pungent odor, which gives it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
